channel.title: mapcubes on GeoScripting
channel.description: Recent content in mapcubes on GeoScripting

item.title: GeoShell Map Cubes
item.description:
I recently posted about creating paper craft map cubes using GeoScript Groovy and geoc CLI. This time, let’s use the GeoShell.

GeoShell is an interactive shell for geospatial analysis. It supports vector, raster, and tile datasets and includes a map module.

item.title: Geoc Map Cubes
item.description: I recently posted about creating paper craft map cubes using GeoScript Groovy. This time, let’s use the geoc command line interface.

item.title: GeoScript Map Cubes
item.description: When my daughters were younger, we discovered cube craft paper models as a fun way to create paper toys. I then discovered that you can do the same thing with maps. The cubed Gnomonic projection is perfect for creating simple map cubes that kids can easily print, cut out, and assemble with a glue stick. Let’s use GeoScript Groovy to create a custom map cube.
